comment.body: NetBeans was originally my number one, then moved to Atom by GitHub, which was very buggy, and then I changed to either VS-Code or Visual Studio Code by Microsoft (not Visual Studio!! And there is a difference between the two beforehand, but I'm yet to find then out ðŸ˜…)

Well, as far as I know, it's just quite some work to implement a worker..
And the user *has* to visit ZeroNet through localhost (or an proxy serving over https), as that allows https-features,.. like a worker-script.

I actually am planning to implement this into [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit), so I mighty write a tutorial on this, if I get it to work ðŸ¤”ðŸ˜…
